content.description: A fun line climbing more or less directly up to the Persistence anchor.  Climb a cool left facing corner at the bottom up to a very featured slab above.
content.protection: a light rack up to #1 camelot
content.location: Left of "Persistence". Either traverse the short 4th class bit to the tree ledge or do "Persistence" and rap into the bottom of "Redneck Olympics".

content.description: A nice, easy, slabby sport line.  A bit of a run between most bolts so make sure you are solid at the grade.
content.location: At the base of the Pond Wall Amphitheater make your way left until the brush runs out in a drop off.  Belay off the tree or start up to the bolt in the middle of the face to the left.  Trend up and left to a chain anchor below the woods.  One single rope rappel puts you on the ledge left of the start.  You'll have to make a 4th class traverse back to the start of the route from here or rap again to the bottom of the ledge below and walk back around to the amphitheater.  The other option is to rap with two ropes back to the tree at the start.

content.description: A good line straight up the highest section of the Pond Wall Amphitheater.  When dry, this route features fun moves and a long pitch.  The route is not super sustained and the crux moves are well protected by bolts.
content.protection: Sport. 10 bolts to Red Pine LO. Rap with 1 60M to a lower tree ledge and rap off fixed slings to the ground.  Make sure you find the mid point of your rope on the second rap as it is exactly 30M to the ground.
content.location: Directly above the approach trail to Double Upper's Pond Wall.

content.description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!
